block.p: Chandra Menez Reddy and Jeffrey Peter Metzler were married last Monday by the Rev. Russell Feroe, a Presbyterian minister, at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

Mrs. Metzler, 27, is an investment banker at J. P. Morgan in Manhattan. She graduated from Brown and received a master's degree in economics from New York University. She was a Fulbright fellow last year in Kenya, where she did fieldwork for her master's thesis.
Chandra Menez Reddy and Jeffrey Peter Metzler were married last Monday by the Rev. Russell Feroe, a Presbyterian minister, at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

Mrs. Metzler, 27, is an investment banker at J. P. Morgan in Manhattan. She graduated from Brown and received a master's degree in economics from New York University. She was a Fulbright fellow last year in Kenya, where she did fieldwork for her master's thesis.

She is the daughter of Dr. Nydia Reddy and Dr. C. V. R. Reddy of Todt Hill, Staten Island. The bride's father is chief of cardiology at New York Methodist Hospital in Brooklyn. Her mother is the medical director of family health services for the Brooklyn South and Staten Island network of the City Health and Hospitals Corporation.

Mr. Metzler, 27, is in his second year at Yale Law School. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown and received a master's degree in public affairs from Columbia. He is a son of Dorothy and Richard Metzler of Charlotte, N.C. His mother is an environmental educator at the Anne Springs Close Greenway, a nature preserve in Fort Mills, S.C. His father, who is retired, was the vice president for research and development at Ivax Industries, a chemical and pharmaceutical manufacturer in Rock Hill, S.C.
